intro: Sebastiania hispida var. graciliramea, commonly known as the slender-stemmed sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and hairy, often glandular leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
